title: Hi Team,
body:
**Describe the bug**
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to '...'
2. Click on '....'
3. Scroll down to '....'
4. See error

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [e.g. iOS]
 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]
 - Version [e.g. 22]

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

title: Add sort to GHContentSearchBuilder
body: The GitHub search API has a [`sort` parameter](https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/search#search-code--parameters), which this API currently does not support. It would be nice to add it.

title: Add label payload
body:
# Description 

Add the label payload that is currently missing. Need it to forcefully apply some colors for a particular label prefix.

Also added some missing javadoc for `GHEventPayload.WorkflowRun` in a separate commit.

# Before submitting a PR:
We love getting PRs, but we hate asking people for the same basic changes every time. 

- [X] Push your changes to a branch other than `master`. Create your PR from that branch.    
- [X] Add JavaDocs and other comments
- [X] Write tests that run and pass in CI. See [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) for details on how to capture snapshot data.
- [X] Run `mvn -D enable-ci clean install site` locally. If this command doesn't succeed, your change will not pass CI. 

# When creating a PR: 

- [X] Fill in the "Description" above. 
- [X] Enable "Allow edits from maintainers".

title: 1.126 and 1.127 releases missing in maven central
body: **Describe the bug** The github project releases defines two latest versions: `v1.126` and `v1.127`, I've got e-mail notifications on both when they were published in [project releases](https://github.com/hub4j/github-api/releases). Proof: https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.kohsuke/github-api Please ensure the artifact is available in central, the github release should be published not earlier. Thanks.

title: Replace reflection with X-HTTP-Method-Override
body:
# Description 

To workaround the limitation where `HttpURLConnection` does not support `PATCH` method, the library was using reflection to change the method string.  This involved quite a bit of hackery. 

This change replaces all that with the `X-HTTP-Method-Override`. 

Tested with a few API calls and but mostly manually updated test resources.

Fixes #754

@aalmiray 

# Before submitting a PR:
We love getting PRs, but we hate asking people for the same basic changes every time. 

- [x] Push your changes to a branch other than `master`. Create your PR from that branch.    
- [x] Add JavaDocs and other comments
- [x] Write tests that run and pass in CI. See [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) for details on how to capture snapshot data.
- [x] Run `mvn -D enable-ci clean install site` locally. If this command doesn't succeed, your change will not pass CI. 

# When creating a PR: 

- [x] Fill in the "Description" above. 
- [x] Enable "Allow edits from maintainers".

title: Add method to check if organization has projects enabled
body:
**Describe the bug**
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

Trying to retrieve organization project boards when they are disabled causes a `GHException`.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Disable organization project boards.
2. Use `GHOrganization#listProjects()`

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

Behavior is expected, however a boolean method would be nice.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows 10
 - Version: 1.126

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

Add a new method `GHOrganization#hasProjects()`, similar to `GHRepository#hasProjects()` to check if projects are enabled.

This information can be retrieved from the organization json under the key `has_organization_projects`.

title: Fix JaCoCo execution when we have additional Surefire options
body:
Typically on Java 16.

Note that the build then fails with Javadoc warnings. Apparently, the Java 16 `javadoc` is a bit stricter. Not sure if we want to disable it for Java 16 for now or if someone wants to fix them (but there are a bunch of them and that would mean documenting very obvious stuff).

title: Expose repository for artifacts, workflows and workflow runs
body: I also added some missing javadoc.

title: Change the name of `GitHubWireMockRule.githubBeforeAfter` to `nonRecordingGitHub`
body: When I was writing that rule, I just couldn't come up with a better descriptive name.  [Thanks @gsmet](https://github.com/hub4j/github-api/blob/feba6ed8b65a03d0b9bcb7f177a47b7e9c7748f7/src/test/java/org/kohsuke/github/GHWorkflowRunTest.java#L43)!

title: Add support for artifacts and logs of workflow runs
body:
@bitwiseman I need your wisdom. The logs and artifacts are downloaded from another host (`https://pipelines.actions.githubusercontent.com/`) and the way it's done currently, this call is not mocked properly.

See https://github.com/hub4j/github-api/pull/1075/files#diff-87252b4de52f4e0e1317a91eee8a0de1cc885f7b84f872989c8e52ec09d2509dR296 for an example of how it is currently done.

I'm unsure of how we could handle this and thought I might as well ask.

Note: the PR is not completed yet, it's still missing tests for the artifacts. I only test the logs method for now.

```
mvn install -Dtest.github.takeSnapshot -Dtest=GHWorkflowRunTest#testLogs
```
works but running the test after that doesn't work as the actual download call wasn't mocked.

title: Add support for repository visibility
body:
# Description 
Adds support for the repository "visibility" field - "public" or "private," plus "internal" for Enterprise
Fixes #932

# Before submitting a PR:
We love getting PRs, but we hate asking people for the same basic changes every time.

title: GHRepository.getWatchersCount() gives stargazers count
body:
Hello there,

Please see title. Thanks.

title: Fix GHRepository#listWorkflows() and add a test
body:
I don't know how I missed it but I forgot to add a test for `listWorkflows()` and... it didn't work properly.

I think we probably need a better infrastructure to deal with all these iterables to avoid having to add so many classes but that's something we can discuss another day :).

title: Add artifacts API
body:
**Describe the bug**
Add support for Artifacts API (https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/actions#artifacts)

They should be accessible from repository and workflow run

title: Make Jacoco work on java 11
Implement GHWorkflow, GHWorkflowRun and associated payloads
body:
This is a draft for now.

I have several questions and there is at least one big issue with the tests.

title: Fix CI issues
body:
# Description 

This PR fixes the CI issues with JDK 16+.

The detail is in each commit. There's a good chance things will need proper fixes but at least we can have a green CI until workarounds are found.

For the record, I pass the options for JDK 11+ as they are needed but not required for JDK 11.

For now, I haven't added 17-ea as Findbugs' ASM version doesn't like it yet.

title: Add the missing fields for GHLabel
body:
# Description 

Add the missing fields for GHLabel (id, nodeId, default).

Fixes #1059

# Before submitting a PR:
We love getting PRs, but we hate asking people for the same basic changes every time. 

- [X] Push your changes to a branch other than `master`. Create your PR from that branch.    
- [X] Add JavaDocs and other comments
- [X] Write tests that run and pass in CI. See [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) for details on how to capture snapshot data.
- [X] Run `mvn -D enable-ci clean install site` locally. If this command doesn't succeed, your change will not pass CI.

- [X] Fill in the "Description" above.

title: Implement getLabel() and getChanges() for GHEventPayload.Issue
body:
# Description 

These two methods were implemented for pull requests but not for issues.

Fixes #1060

# Before submitting a PR:
We love getting PRs, but we hate asking people for the same basic changes every time. 

- [X] Push your changes to a branch other than `master`. Create your PR from that branch.    
- [X] Add JavaDocs and other comments
- [X] Write tests that run and pass in CI. See [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) for details on how to capture snapshot data.

title: Include label information for labeled/unlabeled event payload
body:
When labeling or unlabeling an issue, GitHub includes the added/removed label in the payload and unfortunately it's not included in the payload of the GitHub API.

https://docs.github.com/en/developers/webhooks-and-events/webhook-events-and-payloads#issues

I will try to work on this one ASAP as we need it.

title: Impossible to get IDs of labels assigned to a `GHIssue`
body:
When doing issue search, the results are provided as `GHIssue` which, via `getLabels()`, can provide own label list. 

The problem with this is, the `getLabels()` method returns `List<GHLabel>`, and `GHLabel` doesn't store the unique numerical ID assigned to the label by GitHub. This makes API usage problematic for apps that want to utilize the label ID and cannot rely on its mutable parts like name or URL.

title: [QUESTION] How can I use Search API?
body:
Hello @hub4j team.
I have a question about client usage.

Currently, I want to search files by name in the whole GitHub and get the file data.

For it I found, that I can use the next endpoints:

For getting an answer about files, use:
`https://api.github.com/search/code?q=FILE_NAME&access_token=ACCESS_TOKEN`

For getting data from the files:
`https://raw.githubusercontent.com/REPO/BRANCH/FILE_PATH`


Can I use your client for this purpose? 
If yes, how can I do it?

Thanks in advance,
Roman.

title: Adjust wording used to create the token and give a bit more guidance
body:
# Description 

The current doc says to create a OAuth token but it didn't work very well. AFAICS, we need a personal access token to run the tests.

Note that if I'm incorrect, some additional guidance would be nice.
